snippet: At its core, the Masters is a golf tournament, but fans routinely spurn the greens and instead wait for a half-hour to enter the crowded central merchandise tent at Augusta National Golf Club.
abstract: Tens of thousands of fans flock to merchandise tents at Augusta National Golf Club to buy Masters tournament souvenirs, sometimes choosing to stand in long lines instead of actually watching the competition; experts estimate that club's Masters merchandise outlets take in around $45 million during the week-long event.
lead_paragraph: At its core, the Masters is a golf tournament, but fans routinely spurn the greens and instead wait for a half-hour to enter the crowded central merchandise tent at Augusta National Golf Club.

headline.main: Breaching Sacred Walls to Purchase Souvenirs
headline.print_headline: Breaching Sacred Walls to Purchase Souvenirs
